iucnrdata 0.0.3
  • Reference

IUCN Red List Dataset 2024 (v1)

Source: R/iucn_2024_v1.R
iucn_2024_v1.Rd

A dataset containing the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List taxonomy and assessment data for 163,040 taxa, as of 2024. The data includes information on taxonomic classification, Red List Category, Red List Criteria, criteria version, and population trends.

Usage

iucn_2024_v1

Format

A tibble with 163,040 rows and 16 variables:

assessment_id

Integer. Unique identifier for each IUCN assessment.

internal_taxon_id

Integer. Internal ID for each taxon within the IUCN system.

scientific_name

Character. The scientific name of the taxon.

kingdom_name

Character. The kingdom to which the taxon belongs.

phylum_name

Character. The phylum to which the taxon belongs.

order_name

Character. The order of the taxon.

class_name

Character. The class of the taxon.

family_name

Character. The family to which the taxon belongs.

genus_name

Character. The genus of the taxon.

species_name

Character. The species name of the taxon.

authority

Character. The taxonomic authority for the species, indicating the source of its scientific name.

redlist_category

Character. The IUCN Red List category of the taxon, indicating its conservation status (e.g., "Near Threatened", "Critically Endangered").

redlist_criteria

Character. The criteria used to assign the Red List category.

criteria_version

Numeric. Version of the criteria used in the assessment, typically 3.1 or 2.3.

population_trend

Character. The current trend in the population of the taxon (e.g., "Decreasing", "Stable").

scopes

Character. Geographic scope of the assessment, such as "Global" or "Global & Europe".
